message: I've just announced the private beta of my first web app: http://getfounder.com. The beta will be limited to one city - the one that submits the most sign ups on the location-aware homepage. Here's the related HN thread: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2349980

Why there is no email verification? And hardly any details on how it works, you are just expecting people to have a lot of faith to submit information on the internet.  

And there is no warning to the user that the location is getting tracked - remember, IE9 gives this information as a popup, so this is going to create some distrust amongst users.
@shenoyroopesh good points. I do like the UI, and i believe you are running PHP right?
Sorry @collypops, but how can we "review your startup" when there's no information here?
It's just a lead generation form
It does look great though -- I signed up
also, there have been a number of attempts at this kind of service -- why didn't they work, and what are you doing differently?
